text:
Using any of the mod_vhost_alias directives causes the Alias(Match) and ScriptAlias(Match) 
directives to cease functioning.

The moment I uncomment a line containing a 
VirtualDocumentRoot /www/%0, my server-wide ScriptAliases stop working, as well as All errors 
saying that a 404 was encountered trying to handle the error, since the Alias to /error stops 
working. (And so does the /icons alias).

Not sure if this is an issue with mod_vhost_alias or 
mod_alias, but I'm trying it here.
creator: jason+ap@tangtech.com.au

text:
Created attachment 1803
Make mod_alias run before mod_vhost_alias
creator: slive@apache.org

text:
It looks like the ordering of the translate_name hook has not been very well
thought-out.  Could you please try the attached patch and see if it fixes your
problem.
creator: slive@apache.org

text:
Woops.  Sorry, but I'm not in a position to compile apache at the moment, so
I can't test these.  The second patch should be better.
creator: slive@apache.org
jason+ap@tangtech.com.au
text:
Patching with stock 2.0.36 did not work for me.
Tried editing the changes in manually and 
resulted in an assertion error in apr_hooks.c.
Should I try it with a CVS snapshot or?

creator: slive@apache.org
text:
Yes, you should try it with the CVS snapshot.  There was another ordering change
with respect to mod_alias that went in a couple days ago, and without that
change, you will get conflicts.  Sorry I didn't think of this before.

So you will either need to work from CVS and apply this patch, or work from
2.0.36 and apply the patches from bug 8841 before this one.

Let us know the results.

creator: slive@apache.org
text:
Any luck with this patch?  It looks right to me, but I'm not going to commit
it because I don't have a mod_vhost_alias setup to test it.

creator: slive@apache.org
text: *** Bug 10503 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

creator: slive@apache.org
text: An updated version of this patch was committed.
